**Trollsbane** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is unaligned, and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [morning star](/wiki/Morning_star "Morning star").

[ ]

## Generation

A randomly generated morning star has a base 1⁄20 chance of being made into an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact"), which will always be Trollsbane if no artifacts have already been generated. Trollsbane can be given as a [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") to characters of any role, though it will never be the first one given.

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") that generate with a morning star have a 1⁄2 chance of it being made into Trollsbane if it has not been generated.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

Trollsane has +1d5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals double damage against [trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)"). While wielded, Trollsbane prevents troll [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") from [reviving](/wiki/Reviving "Reviving").

## Strategy

Like most of the [Banes](/wiki/Banes "Banes"), Trollsbane is of limited use - though trolls are often troublesome, they make up a very small portion of the total monsters a character encounters. Trollsbane is also further hampered by its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item")—morning stars are heavy and very rarely used, and lack any incentive to train the skill over using a more accessible artifact weapon. [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") in particular also exemplary of Trollsbane's limited damage against its target monsters: at +0, and accounting for doubled damage, Excalibur deals 14 damage on average versus Trollsbane's 9.

One potential use case for Trollsbane is the [Barbarian quest](/wiki/Barbarian_quest "Barbarian quest"), which pits [Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") against trolls of all types.

## History

Trollsbane first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From [NetHack 3.0.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.3 "NetHack 3.0.3") to [NetHack 3.1.2](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.2 "NetHack 3.1.2"), Trollsbane is a lawful artifact, while from [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3") to [NetHack 3.2.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.2.3 "NetHack 3.2.3"), Trollsbane is chaotic - it is made unaligned in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

The ability to prevent troll corpses from reviving was added in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1").

## Variants

### NetHack: The Next Generation

In [NetHack: The Next Generation](/wiki/NetHack:_The_Next_Generation "NetHack: The Next Generation"), Trollsbane is one of the many artifacts that can be requested at [The Forge](/wiki/The_Forge "The Forge").

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), Trollsbane has a flat +5 to-hit bonus and retains its double damage against trolls, with a 3⁄20 chance of cancelling any troll it hits.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), Trollsbane grants hungerless [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration") while wielded; it deals +d4 bonus damage to all monsters and has a 50% chance of instantly destroying trolls on a successful hit.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), Trollsbane grants hungerless regeneration while wielded, [warns of trolls](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type") and prevents them from leaving corpses - it also has a 1⁄5 chance of instantly killing any trolls it hits.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), Trollsbane is made of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver"), and [morning stars](/wiki/Morning_star#dNetHack "Morning star") are somewhat buffed.

Trollsbane has +1d10 to-hit and +1d20 damage against trolls and monsters with enhanced regeneration, with a 1⁄10 chance of [canceling](/wiki/Canceling "Canceling") one that it hits. It also has a secondary damage bonus of 2d20 + 2x enchantment against [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") monsters, which can stack with the primary damage bonus. It does not resist being held second to other weapons when [twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon"), but is too heavy to use it in the off-hand by almost all characters without a −20 to-hit penalty. Trollsbane is also a sunlight-emitting artifact: [gremlins](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") and [hunting horrors](/wiki/Hunting_horror "Hunting horror") are reduced to dust, and [trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") without [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance") are [petrified](/wiki/Petrified "Petrified").

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), Trollsbane deals +1d20 damage against trolls and grants hungerless regeneration while wielded.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), Trollsbane can be combined with [Werebane](/wiki/Werebane "Werebane") at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") to create [Mortality Dial](/wiki/Mortality_Dial "Mortality Dial").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Trollsbane warns of trolls and has a chance of instakilling any troll it hits, and wielding the artifact will make trolls that see it hostile. Trolls that are killed directly by Trollsbane, or else die while in proximity of the wielded artifact will not leave corpses.

Trollsbane can be combined with [Ogresmasher](/wiki/Ogresmasher "Ogresmasher") at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") to create [Ashmar](/wiki/Ashmar "Ashmar"), an artifact [dwarvish roundshield](/wiki/Dwarvish_roundshield "Dwarvish roundshield").

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") reinstates The Forge from NetHack: The Next Generation, and Trollsbane is one of the many artifacts that can be requested.
